document.docAuthor: Zhang, Dong, Ge, Ying-Qiang, Li, Xin-Yu, Liu, Xian-Hui, Zhang, Ming & Wang, Rong-Rong
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the Lispe caesia - group (Diptera: Muscidae) from Palaearctic and adjacent regions, with redescriptions and one new synonymy

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the Lispe caesia - group (Diptera: Muscidae) from Palaearctic and adjacent regions, with redescriptions and one new synonymy

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Lispe caesia
-group
Hennig, 1960
: 411
; Xue & Zhang, 2005 : 119 ; Zhang et al ., 2005 : 356 .

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Frontal triangle distinctly broad, with dense shinning pollinosity, lateral margin projecting; frontal vitta narrow on both sides; vibrissa of male generally weak (except to
L. flavicornis
and
L. halophora
) or even absent (in males of
L. lanceoseta
and
L. leucocephala
); fore tibia with 1 median seta; fore and mid femora with stout ventral spines (
Fig. 3
); hind tibia generally with 1 av , without pd .

Female: Abdominal sternite 6 and tergite 7 divided medially; abdominal sternite 7 fused with tergite 7 into a median lobe in some species (in
L. caesia caesia
and
L. caesia microchaeta
); sternite 8 mostly absent (except to
L. aquamarina
and
L. flavicornis
); epiproct concave on posterior margin (
Figs. 4
A, B, G, H).
Distribution. Ethiopian (ET), Oriental (OR) and Palaearctic (PA) regions.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1. Swollen and setulose first hind tarsomeres of males from
Lispe caesia
-group. A,
L. aquamarina Shinonaga & Kano
, right leg, posteroventral view, from Liaoning, China. B,
L. caesia caesia Meigen
, right leg, ventral view, from France. C,
L. caesia microchaeta Séguy
, left leg, posterolateral view, from Xinjiang, China. D,
L. candicans Kowarz
, left and right legs, posterior view, from France. E,
L. flavicornis Stein
, right leg, anteroventral view, from Guangdong, China. F,
L. halophora Becker
, left leg, posteroventral view, from Egypt. G,
L. lanceoseta Mou
, right leg, anteroventral view, from Shanxi, China. H,
L. leucocephala Loew
, right leg, ventral view, from Egypt. I,
L. palawanensis Shinonaga & Kano
, left and right legs, lateral view, from Phillipines. J,
L. patellitarsis Bekcer
, left leg, posteroventral view, from Zhanjiang, China. Scale bars: A–J= 0.50 mm.

FIGURE 2. Phallus of males from
Lispe caesia
-group, lateral view. A,
L. aquamarina Shinonaga & Kano
, from Liaoning, China. B,
L. caesia microchaeta Séguy
, from Xinjiang, China. C,
L. flavicornis Stein
, from Guangdong, China. D,
L. patellitarsis Becker
, from Liaoning, China. Scale bars: A–D= 0.25 mm. Abbreviations: bp= basiphallus, disph= distiphallus, ep= epiphallus, ph pro= phallic projection, pt= phallic tube. Color coding: phallic projection dyed in light cyan.

FIGURE 3. Stout ventral spines (arrows) on mid femur of females from
Lispe caesia
-group, anterior view. A,
L. aquamarina Shinonaga & Kano
. B , L. caesia caesia Meigen. C,
L. caesia microchaeta Séguy
. D ,
L. candicans Kowarz
. E ,
L. flavicornis Stein
. Scale bars: A–E= 1.00 mm.

FIGURE 4 (to be continued). Female terminalia of species from
Lispe caesia
-group. Left column,
L. aquamarina Shinonaga & Kano
. Right column,
L. caesia caesia Meigen
. A and B dorsal view, C and D lateral view, E and F ventral view. Scale bars: A–F= 0.50 mm. Abbreviations: cer= cerci, ep= epiproct, hyp= hypoproct, ml= median lobe, ster= sternite, ter= tergite.

FIGURE 4 (continued from previous part). Female terminalia of species from
Lispe caesia
-group. Left column,
L. caesia microchaeta Séguy
. Right column,
L. candicans Kowarz
. G and H dorsal view, I and J lateral view, K and L ventral view. Scale bars: G–L= 0.50 mm. Abbreviations: cer= cerci, ep= epiproct, hyp= hypoproct, ml= median lobe, ster= sternite, ter= tergite.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Included species (and subspecies).
L. aquamarina
Shinonaga & Kano, 1983
(PA);
L. caesia
Meigen, 1826
(PA) (with two subspecies,
L. caesia caesia
Meigen, 1826
and
L. caesia microchaeta
Séguy, 1940
);
L. candicans
Kowarz, 1892
(PA);
L. flavicornis
Stein, 1909
(OR);
L. halophora
Becker, 1903
(PA);
L. hirsutipes Mou
in
Fan, 1992
(PA);
L. lanceoseta Wang & Fan
in
Wang et al. , 1981
(PA);
L. leucocephala
Loew, 1856
(ET and PA);
L. palawanensis
Shinonaga & Kano, 1989
(OR); and
L. patellitarsis
Becker, 1914
(OR and PA).
